難不倒.definition: not to pose a problem for sb; cannot stump sb

難以啟齒.definition: to be too embarrassed to mention sth (idiom); to find it hard to speak about sth

難以實現.definition: hard to accomplish; difficult to achieve

難以應付.definition: hard to deal with; hard to handle

難以捉摸.definition: elusive; hard to pin down; enigmatic

難以自已.definition: cannot control oneself (idiom); to be beside oneself

難保.definition: hard to say; can't guarantee; difficult to protect; difficult to preserve

難倒.definition: to baffle; to confound; to stump

難兄難弟.definition: brothers in hardship (idiom); fellow sufferers; in the same boat

難免.definition: hard to avoid; difficult to escape from; will inevitably

難分難捨.definition: loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate

難分難解.definition: to become caught up in an irresolvable situation (idiom)

難受.definition: to feel unwell; to suffer pain; to be difficult to bear

難字.definition: character that is difficult to recognize or write

難彈.definition: hard to play (of music for stringed instrument)

難得.definition: seldom; rare; hard to come by

難捨難分.definition: loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate

難捨難離.definition: loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate

難搞.definition: hard to deal with; hard to get along with

難易.definition: difficulty; degree of difficulty or ease

難為.definition: to bother; to press sb, usu. to do sth; it's a tough job; sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)

難熬.definition: (of pain or hardship) hard to bear

難當.definition: hard to endure (hot weather, itchiness etc)

難經.definition: Classic on Medical Problems, c. 1st century AD; abbr. for 黃帝八十一難經|黄帝八十一难经[Huang2 di4 Ba1 shi2 yi1 Nan4 jing1]

難纏.definition: (usu. of people) difficult; demanding; troublesome; unreasonable; hard to deal with

難聽.definition: unpleasant to hear; coarse; vulgar; offensive; shameful

難解.definition: hard to solve; hard to dispel; hard to understand; hard to undo

難解難分.definition: hard to untie, hard to separate (idiom); inextricably involved; locked in battle

難言之隱.definition: a hidden trouble hard to mention (idiom); sth too embarrassing to mention; an embarrassing illness

難說.definition: hard to tell (i.e. hard to judge or hard to predict); cannot bring oneself to say it

難走.definition: hard to get to; difficult to travel (i.e. the road is bad)

難辭其咎.definition: cannot escape censure (idiom); has to bear the blame

難逃法網.definition: It is hard to escape the dragnet of the law; the long arm of the law

難過.definition: to feel sad; to feel unwell; (of life) to be difficult

難道.definition: don't tell me ...; could it be that...?
